channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pope Leo warns Gen Z and Gen Alpha that using AI too much could limit their potential: ‘Don’t ask it to do your homework’
item.description: As Gen Z turns to ChatGPT en masse, the pope is sounding the alarm about the erosion of critical thinking skills.

item.title: Alma Allen, American Sculptor, Is Selected for Venice Biennale
item.description: The choice of a relatively unknown artist based in Mexico City ends a chaotic, much-delayed selection process led by the State Department.

item.title: Trump reportedly seeks to extend ACA subsidies as affordability push finds common ground with Mamdani; Centene, Oscar shares jump
item.description: Centene which is a top participant in public health exchanges, jumped 8%, Molina Healthcare rallied 5%, and Oscar Health soared 24%.

item.title: Restrained, Beaten, Asphyxiated: New York Prison Guards’ Brutality Grows
item.description: As frustrations among corrections officers mount, abusive treatment of inmates is rising and becoming more vicious, records and interviews show.

item.title: 73 million Americans will be driving and nearly 18 million will go through TSA in the busiest Thanksgiving travel season in 15 years
As boomers are forced back to work because they can’t afford to retire, Robinhood CEO says Gen Z are opening retirement accounts at just 19 years old
item.description: Robinhood cofounder and CEO Vlad Tenev says young people are embracing old-fashioned investments—and it seems to be working, as the young generation i...

item.title: Rick Cotton, Head of the Port Authority, Is Stepping Down
item.description: Mr. Cotton oversaw the rebuilding of LaGuardia Airport and several other major infrastructure projects in the New York City region.

item.title: Trade Chaos Leads Small Businesses to Rethink U.S. Relationships
item.description: From Sweden to Brazil, six small companies talk about how they are communicating with their U.S. customers amid uncertainty over Trump’s changing tari...

item.title: Russian Disinformation Comes to Mexico, Seeking to Rupture US Ties
item.description: A U.S. government cable said that Kremlin-run outlets had scaled up their efforts across Latin America, seeking to turn people against the United Stat...

item.title: A massive tech update will bring faster, cheaper trading to Wall Street. Get ready for stocks on a blockchain
item.description: Giants like JPMorgan Chase and BlackRock are embracing 'tokenization,' while upstarts like Robinhood and Kraken race ahead.

item.title: Bolsonaro’s Arrest Exposes Limits to Trump’s Power
item.description: President Trump tried to keep the former Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, out of prison. He failed, and now he is moving on.

item.title: Funeral Held for Hezbollah Members Killed in Israeli Strike
item.description: A funeral was held for Hezbollah’s military chief of staff and other members killed in an Israeli airstrike on an apartment in Beirut’s suburbs despit...

item.title: Russian Disinformation Comes to Mexico, Seeking to Rupture US Ties
item.description: A U.S. government cable said that Kremlin-run outlets had scaled up their efforts across Latin America, seeking to turn people against the United Stat...

item.title: Putin’s Win-Win: Take a Russia-Friendly Peace Deal, or Fight On
item.description: The Kremlin’s leader is standing back as Ukraine and Europe scramble to negotiate changes to a U.S. proposal to end the war.

item.title: Grisly Killings of a Married Couple Spark New Sectarian Unrest in Syria
item.description: The government acted quickly to tamp down reprisals in the central city of Homs as it tries to manage repeated waves of bloodshed involving minority g...
